text: Pitch dark. We hear two men speaking FRENCH in hushed voi NOTE: All dialogue is in French until otherwise noted.
(whispering) Turn on the flashlight.
I'm trying.    It doesn't work.
It has to work. You just bought it this afternoon.
A beat.
Do they come with batteries?
You didn't buy batteries?
I thought they came with batteries.
I can't believe you didn't check.
I bought everything you put on the list. Gloves. Pen knives. Flashlight. Batteries were not on the list.
Why should I have to put it on the list? It's like saying to buy a car with tires.
A wealthy neighborhood of Paris off the Champs Elysees. L homes line the secluded street. We see the silhouette of a Peugeot. We MOVE IN closer to see RAYMOND GAYET, 30's, nervously.

Dark. DANIEL FORAY lights his Zippo lighter. He is late 3 tall, handsome with eyes that seem to twinkle in the glow flame. Beside him is JULIEN LABESSE, 30's, hyper. Daniel the LIGHTER on a small table and moves over to a PAINTING wall. Daniel stops at one, removes a pen knife and starts the canvas from the frame. Daniel rolls up the canvas.
Let's go.
Julien starts to pick up the ZIPPO.
Be careful it's...
Too Late! Julien has already picked it up. It burns his h he flicks it away. It flies through the air and lands in of the room. The CURTAINS catch on fire.
... hot!

Julien panics! He grabs the canvas out of Daniel's hand a beating the flames with it. Daniel looks at him with disb Julien flails his arms wildly as he beats back the flames turns to Daniel pleased that his efforts have extinguishe fire, but unaware that the canvas has now caught on fire. Julien sees the flames and puts them out. Daniel just sta him. He opens the canvas. The painting is ruined.
A Mercedes parks in front of the Peugeot, boxing it in be and a car behind it. The DRIVER gets out and walks away.
Daniel and Julien move through the darkness.
Light your lighter. I can't see anything... and try not to burn down the house!
Julien remove a lighter and presses it. The entire room f with light. Julien stares at the flame amazed.
Don't move!

They turn to see an old man standing at the top of the st his bathrobe. He is frail, his face pasty white. He is ho very long, double-barrel shotgun. Julien looks to Daniel with a 'what now' expression. The slowly moves down the stairs. He loses his balance and fa the stairs, tumbling head over heals until he reaches the Daniel and Julien stare at the old man who is sprawled ou floor, motionless.
Is he dead?
I don't know.     He looks dead.
He looked dead before he fell.
The old man groans, then opens his eyes.    He grabs his Daniel and Julien run to the door.
Daniel and Julien run towards the street.
Start the car! Start the car!

Raymond starts the engine.   Daniel and Julien rush acros and get in the back seat. Raymond tries to pull out but there are only a few inches the Mercedes in front and the car behind. Like a pinball between two bumpers the Peugeot jerks rapidly back and fo
Daniel and Julien stare angrily ar Raymond.
You didn't think to move the car before we came out!

Daniel looks out his window and sees... DANIEL'S POV -- the old man runs out of his house with hi and heads towards the car. Raymond is desperately trying to get the car free. They a down as the old man fires. The windows on the left side o car shatter.
Raymond, get us out of here!

Raymond pops up and returns to getting the car out as the opens the breach of the shotgun to reload.. Raymond floors the Peugeot keeping his foot on the brake. engine revs. He turns the wheel to the left and releases The Peugeot juts forward smashing into the rear of the Me and pushing in out into the street. Before the old man ca aim the Peugeot is speeding down the street.
Raymond bites his lip nervously as he drives.    Julien f whole thing amusing. Daniel leans forward.
(to Raymond) You know what makes a good get away driver? (More)
DANIEL (Cont'd) (controlled anger) Being able to get away!
You're always pointing out my negative qualities. My analyst says positive reinforcement is a much more productive way of relating with people.
Fine. Raymond, we'd like to commend you on how well you fucked up tonight.
A narrow street. Daniel carries the cardboard tube as he with Julien and Raymond. They enter a WAREHOUSE.

Two large desks are lined up face to face. One is empty. other is occupied by LAURANT BASTALDI, 40's, all business the side is MARCEL BUROT, 40's. Daniel, Julien and Raymon As they approach the desk Daniel glances at Marcel who is at him.
(amused) I heard you almost got your ass blown off last night. Some thief. A regular black panther.
Marcel glances at Bastaldi to see if he appreciates his c
A Black Panther was a member of an African American militant group in the sixties, Marcel. I think you're referring to The Pink Panther.
Pink panther, black panther. Who gives a shit? And I don't remember asking you a God Damn thing, you little turd.
There's no reason to be abusive. You're projecting your anger on me as a defense mechanism.
What the hell is he talking about?
I'm talking about human beings communicating openly and honestly.
How about getting on your knees and communicating with my dick?
Shut up! Both of you!    You're giving me a fuckin' headache.
A beat. Raymond and Marcel stare at one another.     We H GROANING SOUND in the b.g.
Where's your brother?
Vincent's in the States on business. (a beat; referring to the painting) That it?

Daniel lays the cardboard tube containing the painting on Bastaldi removes the painting. To him it is not a work of just a commodity to be sold. He opens his desk drawer, re several large stacks of money and hands them to Daniel.
Okay.   Now I've got something I want to --

We HEAR the groaning sound again. Bastaldi looks irritate gets up and walks over to a closet. He opens to the doors a man in his underwear, his wrists tied behind his back, taped shut. A wire noose is around his neck forcing him t on his tip toes to avoid hanging himself.
Do you mind? I'm trying to do some business here.
The man looks at Bastaldi through pleading eyes and mumbl something.
One more sound out of you and I'm going to cut your fuckin' tongue out.
Bastaldi closes the door.   Daniel looks at him inquisiti
You take someone in. Give them a steady job and how do they repay you? By claiming to misplace a shipment of your merchandise.
Maybe he did misplace it.
You misplace your car keys.   You misplace your cell phone. (More)
BASTALDI (Cont'd) You do not misplace one hundred and forty seven wide-screen TV's!
Laurant, how long has he been in there?
Bastaldi looks puzzled.
I don't know.     What day is today?
Thursday.
Is it Thursday already?    This week has just shot by.
Bastaldi thinks about something for a moment, then...
You and your crew speak English, don't you?
Daniel is still staring at the closet.
Hey Daniel! Hello? (snaps his fingers) Do you guys speak English?
Uh, yeah.
Good.   I have a job for you in America.
Bastaldi tosses a photo of a middle-aged American couple. to a diamond necklace around the woman's neck.
The Taylors from Chicago. Very rich. An acquaintance of mine recently quit working for Mrs. Taylor as an assistant. She tells me they keep all their jewelry in a safe in their bedroom.
It seems like a long way to go for a necklace.
Besides, we don't know the city and--
(overlapping) Mr. Bastaldi isn't asking you if you want to go. (More)
MARCEL (Cont'd) He's telling you you're going! And if he's telling you you're going to be going then you are going to go!
Thank you Marcel, for that... extremely redundant explanation.
C'mon, Laurant, America?
The job is worth about two million euros. Pull this off and you and your crew could make some real money, Daniel. You leave tomorrow.
They know they don't have a choice.
We're going to need to find someone who knows the city.
I know someone.

The plaza is filled with tourists. Moving through the cro SAMI ZERHOUNI, Algerian, late 20's, a small time street h dressed in jeans and a "I Love Paris" tee-shirt. He passe MAN who is about to take a picture and lifts his wallet. Sami moves on. He sees two overweight women standing at a vendor's cart, holding a large wad of MONEY. The woman pu cash back in her purse, but does not zip it up. Sami moves in behind her and slips his hand into the purs zips the bag closed. Sami's face fills with pain as the z catches the hair of his arm. The women walk towards the cathedral. Sami has no choice but follow after them. He t to match their pace so he doesn't alert them of his prese The woman looks back and sees Sami's hand. She pulls her away, ripping a section of hair off his arm, then swings bag, putting all of her weight behind it. It hits Sami sq in the face. He lands on his back with a thud. WALLETS an BILLFOLDS fly out from every one of his pockets. He staggers to his feet and starts to pick up the wallets he sees... HIS POV -- ACROSS THE PLAZA:    of two police officers mo towards him . He knows he has no more time.    He takes off running, di into the crowd.

Sami is at the bar. He sees Marcel enter and runs towards back. Standing in his way is one of Marcel's MEN. Sami tu around as Marcel approaches and forces a smile. NOTE:   All dialogue is now in English unless otherwise n
Going somewhere?
Oh, Marcel! I thought you were somebody else. If I knew it was you I would have never run.
A long, awkward beat as Marcel just glares at him.
You're probably here for the money I owe you. (off Marcel's nod) I don't have it.
Marcel opens the door to the bathroom and pushes Sami ins
Marcel closes the door.   He is face to face with Sami.
You know this is how rumors get started.
Marcel punches Sami in the stomach. He drops to his knees beat. The door to the bathroom opens and the LARGE MAN pe inside. He stares awkwardly at what he perceives as the b of a sexual act.
Told you.
Marcel slams the door then grabs Sami by the ear and yank his feet.
Today's your lucky day, Sami.
(breathlessly) Yeah, I can see that.

Normally I'd be breaking your fingers right now, but I'm going to give you a chance to make enough to pay me back and have some extra for yourself. We have a group going to Chicago to do a job. You're going with them.
Me?
You lived there. You know the city.
I've still got a few legal problems back in the States.
Marcel glares at him.
(nervously) But I'd be... I'd be happy to go.
Marcel stares at him with hard expression.
If you try to leave town I'll know. If you manage to leave town I'll find you... and the next time we meet in a bathroom I'll be cutting you up into little pieces.
He hands Sami a piece of paper.
Be at this address at nine o'clock tomorrow morning.
Daniel sits with Julien.    At the end of the bar Raymond pay phone.

(in French) Yes, Mama. Yes, I have my vitamins. I have everything. Of course I'm coming back. I'm not leaving you. I'm only going to be gone a few days. I'll call you when I get there. Okay? I've got to go now. (listens) Mama, I've got to go. (listens) No, I'm not yelling.
Sami enters and walks over to Daniel and Julien.
I'm Sami.    Marcel sent me.
What is it you do, Sami?
You know, a little of this, a little of that. I've boosted cars, stole radios, run a few scams. Right now I'm into pick-pocketing.
I see.   A master criminal.
Hey, I was told to come here by Marcel. You guys don't want me, I'll be more than happy to leave.

The door opens. ZERO enters. No one knows his last name. 40's, blonde hair, leather jacket, black pants. Looks mor rock-star than a criminal. His eyes are flat and there is intensity about him that is unnerving. Zero casually nods Daniel. Zero stares at Sami as Daniel leads him over.
(to Sami) This is Zero.
Hi. I'm one and this is two, three, four and five.

Sami laughs at his little joke. The others cringe. One lo Zero's eyes tells Sami what everyone else already knows: not someone to fuck with. Julien puts his arm around Sami leads him away from the others.
Let me give you some advice. You don't want to piss him off because he'll kill you for the fun of it. What you want to do is keep your mouth shut and do what we tell you.
(in French) So, we are going to America?
In English.   Sami doesn't speak French.
Where are you from?
Algeria.
And you don't speak French?
Well, you know, not all Algerians speak French. It's a matter of what school you went too. Me I never really --
(overlapping) -- Zero isn't interested in your life story. (to Daniel) Who gets killed?
Hopefully no one.
(confused) No one? Then why is Zero here?
Sami leans over to Raymond.
He speaks about himself in the third person?
Feel free to correct him if you want.
(to Zero) I just want you there in case there's trouble.
And if there is, then Zero can kill someone?
We'll see.
Daniel and the others step out carrying their suitcases. to a limousine opens and Marcel gets out. The scene is in
(to Daniel) I thought I would accompany you to the airport to say bon voyage... and tell you that Marcel will be going with you.
What?
This is a considerable move up for you, Daniel. The temptation of having so much money might be too much for you.
You don't trust me?
I don't trust anyone. You don't get to the top of this game by trusting people... and after all, you are a thief. It's in your nature to steal. I'm just protecting my investment.

For many of them this is the first time they have ever be a limo. Julien pours himself a drink. Sami plays around w air conditioner. Zero turns on the radio and clicks through a few stations comes to RENAUD singing "Des que le vent souffera." He le in his seat, bobbing his head to the music. Marcel doesn' it. He changes the station. We hear JOHNNY HALLYDAY singi je taime."
That's better.

Zero doesn't like it. He pushes the button returning to t song and stares at Marcel. Marcel, not to be outdone retu Hallyday song. Like two children they click the buttons o radio, switching back and forth between Renaud and Hallyd Bastaldi has had enough.
Stop it!   Both of you!
He turns off the radio. A long beat. Marcel, like a child has to have the last word starts singing to himself quiet loud enough for Zero to hear.
(singing) ... que je t'aime... que je...
Marcel sees Bastaldi glaring at him and stops.
Daniel and the crew get into a mini-van taxi.
Quick cuts of the familiar sights of the city. The Sears Chicago board of trade building. Grant park. Then with ea successive cut the beauty of the city seems to fade until in...
An industrial section of the city. Empty streets. Run dow buildings. Graffiti filled walls and burnt out hulls of a cars line the street. The taxi driver leans out his windo
Are you sure you guys have the right address? This ain't no tourist area.
Marcel looks at a piece of paper he is holding.
Yes.   We are sure.

The taxi speeds off, leaving them standing on the sidewal bags in a pile. Suddenly, from out of nowhere three BLACK appear and walk over. Daniel looks behind him and sees an two approaching from the rear. Zero calmly sits down on o the suitcases.
Let me handle this.
LAMAR, 30's, the leader of the group steps forward.
Hey, brother.     What's happening, man?
Sami raises his hand as if to greet Lamar.
Don't you brother me, motherfucker.
Sami looks like an idiot with his hand up in the air.   H lowers it. Lamar looks over the group and grins.
What's in the bags?
Dirty underwear.
Lamar forces a laugh.
Dirty underwear. That's a good one. Let me explain something to you. This is my street and you're gonna give me want I what or I'm gonna bust your heads open.
Raymond steps forward and places his hand on Lamar's arm.
Lamar, violence is never an answer to settling disputes. I can see you have a lot of anger... but this is not the way to get it out.
Get outta my face!
Lamar removes a knife. The others in his group bring out assortment of clubs, chains and pipes.
Now, are you going to give me the suitcases? Or are we going to have to take them?
Zero is still sitting on one of the suitcases.
Va te faire foutre!
What did he say?
He said to go fuck yourself.
We are tired and bored with your bullshit. So, put that stupid little knife away before Zero shoves it up your ass.
Who is Zero?
He is.
(to Julien) He speaks about himself in the third person?
Julien shrugs his shoulders.
Maybe Zero would like to get off his ass and take my knife from me?
If you insist.

Zero stands up and raises his hand.   He is holding a .9m He aims it at Lamar's head. Lamar's brave exterior quickly fades now that he is looki the barrel of the gun. The rest of his gang turns and run Zero aims the gun at his groin.
Leave now before Zero shoots off those little raisins you call balls.
Lamar runs away. Daniel and the others smile at Zero as t up their bags and walk towards a building.
Zero is left with Sami who stares at him with disbelief.
You put a loaded gun in your bag and brought it through customs? How stupid is that?
Zero did not put it in his bag.    He put it in yours.
Zero grins and walks away.
The crew stands at a door. Marcel knocks.     A peep-hole door is opened and an eye looks them over.
We are looking for Sophie.    Laurant send us.
The door is opened by SOPHIE (the girl in the photo on Ba computer). She is late 20's, beautiful.
(softly) Ouh La La.
An old building, the rooms are partitioned off by sheets from the ceiling. The main area is an artists workspace w large abstract paintings lean against the wall.
I wasn't expecting this many of you. I've got a few sleeping bags you can use.
Thanks.
Of to the side, sitting on the couch is WAYNE, 20's, a bu with long hair and a scraggly goatee. His face is buried bong as he sucks in a lung full of marijuana. He watches show on the television.
(to all of them) This is Wayne. My roommate.
Raymond walks over to him.
I am Raymond.     Thank you for allowing us to stay here.
No problem, man. (offers him the bong) Hey, you wanna hit?
No thank you.
Raymond looks at the television and sees a cartoon show.
Oh, Pepe Le Pew. He is very funny and quite well known in France.
Yeah, I dig him.
Although a cartoon I feel he shares a universal theme: We are all searching for love. No?
Wayne stares at him with a dead pan expression as he trie assemble a coherent thought.
Whoa...   That's deep.
You guys hungry?
Because of the hour the room is not crowded. Only a few P sit at the counter sipping coffee. A WAITRESS, 50's, bee hair style, face covered in make up arrives at the table.
Ready to order?
Julien looks up at her.
Could we see a wine list please?
(smirks) That's cute.
They don't have a wine list.
Oh, then we will have the house wine.
Sure -- and would you like that before your escargot in white truffle sauce?
I did not order escargot.
They don't serve wine here.
What kind of restaurant doesn't serve wine?
This kind.
Okay.    I will have a beer.
I don't think he's grasping the concept. Iced tea, lemonade, coca cola, sprite or root beer.
(to the others) C'est quoi root beer?
He'll have a sprite.    We'll all have sprite.
Good. Now that we've gotten the beverage selection out of the way, dare we move on to the main course?
Idiot.
Zero grins as he puts a cigarette in his mouth.     The w it out of his mouth.
And no smoking.
(in French) No smoking? No drinking?       What kind of country is this?
VINNY, 40's, not the brightest bulb on the tree. His head back as someone punches him in the face. Blood flows from nose. We are in...

Two GANGSTERS stand on each side of Vinny. They are JOEY TONS" 40's, could have a second career as a Sumo Wrestler "THE RAKE", 30's, thin a rail. They make a strange pair b both have one thing in common: They are stone cold killer Standing in front of the them is FRANKIE ZAMMITO, 30's, a guy, tough as they come. He wears a well tailored suit, b leather gloves and polished shoes.
(frightened) I'm sorry, Frankie.     Really.
Vinny gets off his knees and moves towards Zammito.
You bleed on me, I'll kill ya.
Vinny takes a step back.
What'd I tell you? Huh, Vinny? What'd I tell you when you came to me for money? Didn't I ask you not to do it? Did I not say that? (to Joey) What'd I say to him?
You said don't do it, boss.

That's right. I said don't do it. Did you listen to me? No. You wanted the money. So, I lent you twenty large. Now it's been three weeks and you ain't paid a dime. What do you think that makes me look like on the street? I don't do something to you and everyone will think they can skate.
Frankie, I --
-- Shut up! Don't you try to make me feel bad about this. You knew what would happen to you if you didn't pay. This is on your head, not mine. (to Joey and Nicky) Break his arm.
Vinny looks up at Zammito through pleading eyes.
Jesus, Frankie, I'm your brother!
That's why we're only breaking one arm.
The table is littered with plates.   Sophie has sketched diagram of a house on her napkin.
There's an exterior alarm system. There's also another one in the hall that leads to the bedroom with a motion detector. The control panel is in the bedroom.
I can handle the exterior alarm, but the one in the bedroom is a problem.
After the outside alarm is off we go in through the bedroom window.
(impressed) Good. Zero and Julien will go in through the window and disable the motion detector. The rest of us will come in through the front door.
What about transportation?
You can use my car.
Not a good idea. Someone gets a license number and it all leads back to you. Raymond, you'll steal one.
No problem.
When do we go?
Tonight.
Tonight?
I know they won't be home tonight.
You ever hear of jet lag?
Take a nap.
As they crew and Sophie approach the door we hear the mut of loud MUSIC.
As the enter the music is even louder. The bass pounds th the walls. Wayne seems oblivious to it as he sits on the smoking a joint.
What the hell is that?
Neighbors.    They do this all the time.
I can't even hear myself think.
How are we supposed to sleep with this noise?
I've asked them a hundred times to keep in down. They don't listen.
I will talk to them.
Sophie and Wayne both find his offer amusing.
Yeah.   Right.
Not a good idea.
It's just a matter of communication.
Raymond leaves.

Raymond walks towards a door at the end of the building. grows louder. He KNOCKS on the door and waits. It is open very large man... a biker type, leather jacket, full bear long earrings hanging from his ear. He is holding a BEER Behind him are two other rough-looking men.
(cheerfully; loudly over the music) Hello. My name is Raymond. I am visiting next door and I was wondering if you could make your music a little less loud.
The Biker takes a sip of his beer.
No.
But the music is very--
Before Raymond can finish his sentence the Biker pours hi over Raymond's head.
Fuck off!
He slams the door in Raymond's face.

The music continues to pound through the walls. A soggy R steps into the room. He walks over to a chair and sits do head hung down, embarrassed. Marcel is angered by this. H over to Daniel who subtly nods to him. Marcel leaves the
Marcel walks purposefully along the side of the building. reaches into his jacket pocket and removes two black leat He slips them on as he approaches the door, then knocks. The Biker opens the door.
Listen asshole, I told you --

Marcel head butts him, slamming his forehead into the bri his nose. The Biker clasps his hands over his bleeding no Marcel grabs him by the hair and rapidly punches him in f times -- each punch backing the Biker into the room.

On the last punch the Biker falls backwards crashing thro large glass coffee table. BIKER #2 moves in behind Marcel and throws a hard punch a turns around. Marcel bends his head down, so that his att fists slams into the hard crown of his skull. BIKER #2 painfully grabs his broken knuckles. Marcel knee hard in the groin. BIKER #2 turns to his side and doubles Marcel kicks the man into the back of his knee spinning h and down on his knees.

In a fluid movement he elbows the man in the back of head #2 falls face forwards and is out cold. Marcel turns to the third BIKER who is standing by the st is smaller than the others and has seen enough. He quickl off the power. DEAD QUIET.
Marcel enters.   Wayne is on the couch with Raymond.
(impressed) What'd you say to them?
(dryly) Nothing.
A plain looking building in an old neighborhood of the ci
Zammito sits at his desk. Joey "Two Tons" and Nicky "The sit on the couch. Bobby Beans balding, stocky enters.
Hey, Bobby beans... How you doin'?
He walks up to Zammito and they kiss each other on the ch
Good. I'm doing good. How you doin', Frankie?
Good.   I'm good.
Mr. Maranzano sends his warmest regards.
When you return please extend my regards to Mr. Maranzano and his family.
Zammito motions for Bobby to sit down.
Can I offer you something.    A drink? Coffee?
No thank you.
ZAMMITO
You sure? I just got a shipment of espresso from Sicily. Special blend. Can't find anything like it in the States. BOBBY BEANS
I'm good.   Really. ZAMMITO
Okay. I understand you're interested in one of our properties? BOBBY BEANS
Yeah. That warehouse over on Merchant Street. The volume on our import business has risen dramatically. The proceeds this quarter will be supernumerary due to the -- ZAMMITO (overlapping)
-- Super what? BOBBY BEANS
Supernumerary. It means better than expected. ZAMMITO
Then why not just fuckin' say better than expected? Everybody knows what better than expected means. BOBBY BEANS
I'm taking a vocabulary course to enhance my communication skills. ZAMMITO
Okay.   How much? BOBBY BEANS
I'm not here to negotiate. ZAMMITO
Why are you here? BOBBY BEANS
To tell you that we're interested in the property. ZAMMITO

You told me that on the phone. What the hell are you doing here? Showing off your communication skills? Go back to your people and tell them when they're serious to put a number on the table. BOBBY BEANS
I will relay the particulars of our conversation to Mr. Maranzano.
Yeah -- you do that.
Bobby Beans leaves.
Jerk-wad!
Zammito looks over at Joey and Nicky.
How's my brother?
He's over at St. James. They had to put two pins in his arm.
I said a clean break.
Hey boss, it's not a science.
Send some flowers. Something nice. Roses or carnations. And one of those get well soon cards.
Nicky gets up to carry out his instructions.
Oh and uh, send a case of steaks over to his house. I don't want the kids to go hungry while he's recuperating.
Julien and Zero are playing cards at the back of the room sitting by himself sorting through a BLACK CANVAS BAG fil shoes. Sophie joins him. Sami pulls another pair of shoes the canvas bag.
You like shoes?
No, I like the bag. It would be good for the job tonight.
It belongs to Vincent Bastaldi. He left it last time he was here. I'm sure he wouldn't mind if you used it.
Sami dumps the rest of the shoes out of the bag.
So, how did you get hooked up with these guys?
Just lucky I guess. How'd you start working for the Bastaldi's?
The art world doesn't fully appreciate my talent yet. I needed some way to pay the rent. Laurant and Vincent pay well for information.
So you arranged to have the people you worked for robbed?
They're not nice people.
She sees a TATTOO on Sami's arm.    It's a heart with som name.
I like your tattoo.
Sami is suddenly self-conscious of it.    She traces alon with her finger.
(reading the name) Casandra. Old girlfriend?
Something like that.
Did she break your heart?
Something like that.
It looks old.     Did you get it a long time ago?
You ask a lot of questions.
That's how you get to know someone.       Did it hurt when you got it?
I don't remember.    I was drunk.
You got it in a bar?
No. I got it in prison. I went in for three years. When I came out she was married to my best friend. Happy?
Sorry.   I didn't mean to pry.
It's okay.   It was a long time ago.
I've been thinking about getting tattoo. You know, a flower or something. On my ass.
Sami looks at her quizzically.
Who's gonna see it there?
The lucky ones.
She smiles flirtatiously and walks away.

A car drives up. We can only see the outline of an old Ch Impala. Two men get out of the car, leaving the engine ru they head for the liquor store. Across the street Raymond is checking out a Buick LaSabre stops when he sees the flashing alarm light on the dashbo looks across the street and sees the Impala.
An OLD MAN is behind the counter.   Two masked men enter and rush up to the counter.
Gimme the money!
The old man opens the cash register and hands him all the
Open the safe!
I don't have the combination.
Raphael pistol whips him with his gun and drags him half the counter, then presses his gun to the old man's head.
I swear!   I don't have it!
Raphael pushes him to the floor.    He runs out of the st the others.
They run out and remove their masks. RAPHAEL RUIZ, 20's, tough, shaved head, neck covered with tattoos. HECTOR, La small, cubby, stops and stares at something with confusio
Hey, Vato, where's your car?
Raphael stops as he sees the street is empty.
